question.text:
Match the items given in Column I with those in Column II and select the correct option given below:
 
  Column - I   Column - II
a. Glycosuria i. Accumulation of uric acid in joints
b. Gout ii. Mass of crystallized salts within the kidney
c. Renal calculi iii. Inflammation in glomeruli
d. Glomerular nephritis iv. Presence of glucose in urine

options.text: a - ii, b - iii, c - i, d - iv
a - i, b -ii, c - iii, d - iv
a - iii, b - ii, c - iv, d - i
a - iv, b - i, c - ii, d - iii

solution.text:
Glycosuria- a condition characterized by an excess of sugar in the urine, typically associated with diabetes or kidney disease.

Gout- Gout is a form of inflammatory arthritis due to the accumulation of uric acid in joints

Renal calculi- A serious complication occurs due to the mass of crystallized salts within the kidney. They are also called kidney stones.

Glomerulonephritis- It is the inflammation in glomeruli

Therefore option 4) is correct.
